alert.note: Alert for Crane; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Pecos; Reagan; Terrell; Upton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 16 at 3:36PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... The Flood Watch continues for * WHERE...Portions of southeast New Mexico and Texas, including the following areas, in southeast New Mexico, Central Lea County, Eddy County Plains, Guadalupe Mountains of Eddy County, Northern Lea County, and Southern Lea County. In Texas, Andrews, Borden, Crane, Davis Mountains, Davis Mountains Foothills, Dawson, Eastern Culberson County, Ector, Gaines, Glasscock, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Howard, Loving, Martin, Midland, Mitchell, Pecos, Reagan, Reeves County Plains, Scurry, Terrell, Upton, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor, Ward, and Winkler. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Crane; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains; Pecos; Reagan; Terrell; Upton
